intro: Freziera risaraldana, commonly known as the Risaraldan frost plant, is a unique species native to the Andean region of Colombia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small white flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests. Its botanical structure includes a short stem with a cluster of leaves at the base, and it produces an edible, aromatic seed pod. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
